message.content:
cs.NI, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with energy-efficient multi-hop broadcast in wireless networks, which is a topic related to network optimization and game theory. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also proposes a cost-sharing game for finding the minimum-power broadcast-tree, which falls under the category of algorithmic game theory, making cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) another likely category. Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of circuitry power on the energy-efficiency of the network, which relates to distributed computing (cs.DC) and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper uses the marginal contribution (MC) cost-sharing scheme, which is a concept from information theory (cs.IT).
